title: United States Office Investment Review
name: ./office-investment.pdf
description: This presentation is an overview of investment trends in the United States Office market, covering all transactions greater than $5 million in the top 50 markets across the country.
It sources JLL’s in house data, as well as third-party data sources including the Federal Reserve, Real Capital Analytics and the National Council of Real Estate Investment Fiduciaries.
It was delivered to JLL’s leadership and key clients.

title: Money Doesn't Grow on Trees: It Comes From Venture Capital Firms
name: ./2015-VC-infographic.pdf
description: This infographic details the relationship between venture capital funding and real estate markets.
It sources JLL’s in house data, as well as third-party data sources including Yahoo Finance.
It was delivered to JLL’s Tenant Representation group to aid decision making on location and footprint for technology clients.

name: ./2017-cbre-retail-whitepaper.pdf
title: How Is New York City Positioned To Handle The Challenges Of Today's Retail Market?
description: This white paper examines New York City’s retail market in the context of ongoing retail bankruptcies and store closures across the United States.
It sources CBRE’s in house data, as well as third-party data sources including Moody’s Analytics, the U.S. Census Bureau and the New York City Comptroller.
It was published to global subscribers of CBRE Research and used to aid decision making for clients of CBRE’s retail tenant representation group.

name: ./omnichannel-viewpoint.pdf
title: New York City Embraces Omnichannel Retail
description: This white paper discusses the evolution of online and omnichannel retail in New York City and how brands are adapting to evolving technology.
It sources CBRE’s in house data, as well as third-party data sources including Adobe Analytics and the U.S. Census Bureau.
It was published to global subscribers of CBRE Research and used to aid decision making for clients of CBRE’s retail tenant representation group.
